The above example JSP saved in an arbitrary directory of the OpenCms virtual file system, e.g., at /system/examples/hello.jsp, will render the following HTML page:

  • the numbers 1 to 10 as an unordered list
  • the current date in a formatted way
  • the string "Hello JSP" in upper case
  • the current version of the OpenCms servlet

Template JSPs are stored in Modules, by convention in a folder called templates/. Say there is a module named org.opencms.examples, then the template would be saved at /system/modules/org.opencms.examples/templates/ in the virtual file system of OpenCms.

OpenCms provides a special resource type called Page template for template JSPs. It is good practice to give your template JSP the special page template type since, if a content administrator creates a new website with the Websites app, all page templates appear in the drop-down list, whilst normal JSP do not appear here.
